name: line
summary: The `<line>` element is an SVG basic shape used to create a line connecting two points.

x1.name: x1
x1.summary: The `x1` attribute is used to specify the first x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

x2.name: x2
x2.summary: The `x2` attribute is used to specify the second x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

y1.name: y1
y1.summary: The `y1` attribute is used to specify the first y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

y2.name: y2
y2.summary: The `y2` attribute is used to specify the second y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).
